CIRCULAR NO.  6 / 2007 
 
In continuation of this Bureau Circular No. 35/2005 dated 23.8.2005  on the 
subject of guarding of  Refusal Room at airports (International), the following instruction 
shall be implemented by all concerned:- 
 
1. The entire infrastructure for the refusal room will be provided by the AAI/Airport 
Operator. The design of the Refusal Room will be sent to BCAS by AAI/ Airport 
Operator for security vetting. Necessary facilities in the Refusal Room will be 
provided by the concerned Airport Operator. 
 
2. Guarding of the Refusal Room is the responsibility of CISF for which a guard of 
one Head Constable and 04 Constables will be provided. CISF may project  
manpower requirements for sanction. 
 
3. Food and other facilities to the deportees will be provided by the concerned 
airlines. 
 
4. If a deportee is under the influence of liquor or he is violent, he will be kept in the 
Refusal Room under proper guard of the CISF till he is handed over to local 
police. 
 
5. No charges will be levied for the Refusal Room on the Bureau of Immigration. 
 
The APSU/ CISF and concerned airlines should take necessary action 
accordingly. B.O.I, Local Police and Airport Operators (AAI or otherwise) should also be 
apprised through APSC to implement this direction meticulously.  
 
 
 
(M.Malaviya) 
Addl. Commissioner of Security (CA)
